column4: Um hello. I had this error. so I followed instructions. ICEauthority or something like that. Now my permissions are messed up. When I click places and home folder it gives me an error about nautilius could not create the following required folders /home/meway/Desktop,/home/meway/.nautilus.
Also now I have to type sudo in for everything
including ls
wtf :{
live disk or another user and ls -la it, better live disk, ls -la then change the perms
try sudo su first then see if you can ls -la as root
you have root yes ?
open a terminal, type sudo su
then type ls -la
the issue is your perms, ls -la will tell you what belongs to what then you can change it back to you as the owener
ls -la comes back with -la not found ?
nvm got it
Idk what I am looking at
nothing should be root
How do I change a line than?
chown -R meway:meway some folder
change meway for your user name of course
just run that in your homw folder then
chown -R meway:meway *
reboot
chown root:root /usr/bin/sudo then chmod 4111 /usr/bin/sudo
